text:
newbie question for login from the doc:

import betfairlightweight
trading = betfairlightweight.APIClient(
        "username", "password", app_key="app_key", certs="/certs"
    )
trading.login()

what should the app_key parameter be? Should I copy and paste out the 1592 character .pem file? (I've tried that and it doesn't seem to do anything)

text: Appreciate the help Liam but I have pretty basic knowledge and unless there's step by step instructions for all of this on YouTube or something it's probably out of my league. What I have is an excel file with data being refreshed into it e.g. (Event) Cheltenham Race 1, (Outcome) 12. Majed, (Price) 2.5 and I want to map this to placing automated BACK bets on the corresponding exchange market, outcome and price in real-time (ish). I'm a recreational gambler and just testing some things out, but if anybody wants to reach out with help with putting something together I'm happy something to pay for your time. Would ideally like to do screenshare sessions so I can learn something along the way

text:
Andy do you have two step?
If so you need to include that too
My Python knowledge is very basic (so this may not be the best way to do this...but it works :grinning:)
This is my code:

```myacc = str(input("please enter account name: "))
app_key = str(input("Please enter key: "))
mypass = str(input("Please enter Password and 2FA: "))
trading = betfairlightweight.APIClient(myacc,mypass, app_key, certs=r"C:\certs")```
so you just add your 2FA onto your password. As i say, there is prob a better way....good luck

elements.text:

If so you need to include that too
My Python knowledge is very basic (so this may not be the best way to do this...but it works

This is my code:

myacc = str(input("please enter account name: "))
app_key = str(input("Please enter key: "))
mypass = str(input("Please enter Password and 2FA: "))
trading = betfairlightweight.APIClient(myacc,mypass, app_key, certs=r"C:\certs")
so you just add your 2FA onto your password. As i say, there is prob a better way....good luck

text: <@U04J6LUGCFM>  Looking at your earlier invalid app key messages, and your success with the delayed key, it seems to me your live key hasn't been activated. Have you explicitly requested its activation?

elements.text: Looking at your earlier invalid app key messages, and your success with the delayed key, it seems to me your live key hasn't been activated. Have you explicitly requested its activation?

text: Hi Peter. I hadn’t. It was just the top option was 1.0 and 1.0 DELAY intuitively seemed the poorer option :grinning: I know what they both mean now and have used 1.0 DELAY with success to log in
